The Police Complaints Commisson (PCC) will conduct an independent investigation (as they autoamtically do in any incident where armed officers use their firearms) and despite any mitigating circumstances I'm guessing they will be highly critical of the use of lethal force in this incident.

It means nothing what was found after the fact, only the information and situation that the officers were presented with at the time they had to make their decisions.  These are not verified facts, but what had been and continues to be reported in the media. 
 1. He was wearing a heavy jacket in warm weather, which certainly seems suspicious.
 2. He jumped a turnstyle into the subway.
 3. He ignored police orders to stop.
 4. He ran from police despite continued orders to stop.
 5. He boarded a train (which seems to be a favorite target of terrorist bombers lately), despite police orders to stop.
 
 Now I am not a cop, but if these circumstances are true, I probably would have feared that he had a bomb strapped to him with intention to blow it up and kill people. If these were my impressions, I would have shot him too. 
 
 
We all will, as f*ck ups like this one can do huge amounts of damage to Police operations against terrorists cells within the UK.

 It could also let terrorists know that people are watching, and that they might not live to detonate their bomb if they are caught. The reverse side of this is that if this incident turns out to be unjustified, the police could have restrictions imposed on them that might just allow a bomber that couple extra seconds of opportunity that he needs to blow his bomb up. 
 
 Give the investigation a chance to uncover all of the facts before you drawl and quarter the officers.

 These are not verified facts, but what had been and continues to be reported in the media. 
 1. He was wearing a heavy jacket in warm weather, which certainly seems suspicious.

 These are the facts as we know them. He did engage in actions that any Police Officer would have found suspicious. However, these actions did not only suggest the man could have been a bomber. As a matter of fact they were the action of a man whose visa had expired and was fearful of possible deportation. However the Officers have assumed he was a terrorist, assumed he had a bomb and assumed lethal force was the only option. Perhaps also there is a wider issue- it shows how careful the Police has to be in deployment of units that are trained to respond with lethal force- should such Officers been deployed in this instance? if they had been unarmed Mr Menezes would now be in Police custody and a fading memory to us all.
 
 
It could also let terrorists know that people are watching, and that they might not live to detonate their bomb if they are caught. The reverse side of this is that if this incident turns out to be unjustified, the police could have restrictions imposed on them that might just allow a bomber that couple extra seconds of opportunity that he needs to blow his bomb up.

 
 And now you understand my anger at this incident- mistakes like this could hamper the Police in the future. We can ill afford incidents like this happening given the nature of the threat posed by suicide bombers.

They goofed up, however, at the point when you are dealing with a real suicide bomber there is no other tactic. Can't take the risk of tackling them, we know from extensive numbers of captured vests they have operator trips as well as pressure switches on the chests. Can't shoot them somewhere they won't be disabled by as they will just set it off. Can't shoot them in the chest as most explosives are shock sensitive and most people aren't rendered instantly incapacitated by chest shots. Head shots are the only option.

Well, more has now come out about the shooting of Mr. Menezes some of which suggests there was a deliberate mis-information campaign to try cover over the actual nature of the incident.
 
 1. Menezes was not wearing a "heavy coat" at all, but was dressed in a denim jacket.
 
 2. He never vaulted any barriers.
 
 3. He only ran to get aboard a departing tube train.
 
 More importantly he had been misidentified as Hussain Osman, a suspect associated with the bombings who was under survelience by Police. Also, the decision to use lethal force was taken in advance, in this instance if the "suspect" ran.
 
 Read more here.
 
 So I think I can return to my original analysis that this was a f*ck up that led to an innocent man being shot.
